title: Using a Macbook
body:
So for over a year I've been playing on my 5 year old Macbook pro, and I get around 35 fps and pings usually 16, but occasionally I get random frame drops (to as low as 5), and if I've got chrome or itunes open while playing I'll probably dc in load and lag all game. Even with nothing open, my average load times around 5 minutes.
To all you other mac users, what's your load time like, how can I improve mine, and how old is it?
Cheers, ELBERSHAYZ

replies.body: you can improve it by updating to windows xp sp1...

Try doing a defrag and updating drivers and making sure LoL has High prority so most of your cpu will go towards running it over other programs I used to get 60 now I'm getting 100-130 and down to 30-60 in big team fight I am on an acer laptop though but this might help you
I think defrag is more a windows thing but thanks for the tips
Nah mines fine, its probs cause you're only silver.
try getting a computer that isn't a 5 year old macbook.

> [{quoted}](name=GoldenTomat0,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=ZuLoqktk,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-01-16T03:35:19.244+0000)
>
> try getting a computer that isn't a macbook.

Fixed.

Mine is a 2013 macbook pro, load time is pretty slow but usually fps is 60+. Ping is usually stable at around 56 (dependent on internet anyway).
I have also played league on a 2008 macbook and the fps and ping was similar, load time was probably slightly slower.

My Macbook is about 2 years old now, and occasionally the ping and FPS do go out of the suitable range. And i found that when i close all the programs, it'll sometimes fix it. Another thing is that if there are more people on your internet then it could make your game laggy, especially if your laptop is a bit old. 

Do take into account however that everyone occasionlly will have an FPS drop or high ping due to the servers.
